Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure lower body of komast to left, with added red on buttock and upper thigh, jumping with knees bent and both feet off the ground; below, black band above red band.
Curator's comments: For the jumping figure, compare Athens, NM 12688, tripod kothon in ABV, 33, no. 680: Manner of the KY Painter; Pickard-Cambridge, A., Dithyramb, Tragedy and Comedy, 2nd edn, rev. T. B. L. Webster, Oxford 1962, pl. 3, no. 10: 575-550 BC.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.21.2)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 228, no. 21)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 263, no. B186)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0126) (Phase 1)
Alexandridou 2011 / The Early Black-Figured Pottery of Attika in Context (c. 630-570BCE) (p. 123) (Naukratis 104)
